qas.question: At the end of what period would universities become alike to contemporary universities?

answers.text: the end of the early modern period

qas.question: What type of focus did universities have at the end of the early modern period?
What replaced theological studies in universities at the completion of the early modern period?
The change in universities towards the completion of the early modern period is credited with the formation of what entity?
The study of the humanities at the end of the early modern period replaced the study of the work of what individual?

plausible_answers.text: the end of the early modern period

qas.question: At the end of what period would universities become a fixture?
What type of focus did universities have at the end of the modern state?
What replaced theological studies in universities at the completion of the modern state?
The change in universities towards the completion of the modern period is credited with the formation of what entity?
The study of the humanities at the end of the modern state replaced the work of what individual?

context: By <a0_0><b5_0>the end of the early modern period<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the structure and orientation of higher education had changed in ways that are eminently recognizable for the modern context. <a4_0><b9_0>Aristotle<b9_0/><a4_0/> was no longer a force providing the epistemological and methodological focus for universities and a more <a1_0><b6_0>mechanistic<b6_0/><a1_0/> orientation was emerging. The hierarchical place of theological knowledge had for the most part been displaced and the <a2_0><b7_0>humanities<b7_0/><a2_0/> had become a fixture, and a new openness was beginning to take hold in the construction and dissemination of knowledge that were to become imperative for the formation of <a3_0><b8_0>the modern state<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
